memberdef.type: std::unordered_map< elm::ElementIDStruct, std::vector< std::tuple< elm::ElementIDStruct, double > > >
memberdef.name: EdgeMapType

briefdescription.para: Number of trials.

detaileddescription.para: How many times to repeat the requested number of iterations, hoping to find a better imbalance. This helps if it's easy to get stuck in a local minimum.

briefdescription.para: Whether to make migration choices deterministic.

detaileddescription.para: This will only lead to reproducibility when paired with deterministic object loads, for example when using a driver that feeds the load balancer object loads read from vt LB data files.

briefdescription.para: Whether to roll back to the best iteration.

detaileddescription.para: If the final iteration of a trial has a worse imbalance than any earlier iteration, it will roll back to the best iteration.

briefdescription.para: Whether to adjust the target load when we have a long pole.

detaileddescription.para: When an object load exceeds the processor-average load (i.e., we have a "long pole"), adjust the target load to be the maximum object load ("longest pole") instead of the processor-average load.

briefdescription.para: Type of strategy to be used in transfer stage.

Try locks that have arrived from other ranks.

briefdescription.para: Compute the amount of work based on the work model.

simplesect.para: Model: α * load + β * inter_comm_bytes + δ * intra_comm_bytes + ζ * shared_comm_bytes + γ

the external communication
